verb.description: Express dissatisfaction or annoyance about something.
examples: local authorities complained that they lacked sufficient resources
You never listen to me, Larry complained
we all complained bitterly about the food

verb.description: State that one is suffering from (a pain or other symptom of illness)
examples: her husband began to complain of headaches

verb.description: (of a structure or mechanism) groan or creak under strain.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French complaindre, from medieval Latin complangere bewail, from Latin com- (expressing intensive force) + plangere to lament.
